messages: 40d5ff31271cbdc9cb27402857c19c18 (02:32): how do I make a <ul> so that its flush left? what is the setting I need to change?

40d5ff31271cbdc9cb27402857c19c18 (02:38): and that effects all <li> in the page?

f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:50): swimrr: probably because there's a margin or padding on the <p>?

f9f55a3e8be14fc877a9ae5642b53041 (02:54): why is it inside a table?
40d5ff31271cbdc9cb27402857c19c18 (02:56): i know i know...tables are not for layout
40d5ff31271cbdc9cb27402857c19c18 (02:56): but i've been testing it outside the table - margin-left and padding-left =  0  take out the bullets
40d5ff31271cbdc9cb27402857c19c18 (03:08): ok - how can I have a list and have the title right above it flush with the buttons

62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (03:34): swimrr: You could decrease the font size of the li while increasing it to compensate on an element inside
40d5ff31271cbdc9cb27402857c19c18 (03:35): guess what - I have it setup beautifully using 1em for FF, but in IE it cuts off half the circle
